snippet: GlaxoSmithKline said the cooling towers where Legionella bacteria was found do not release air or water into the plant. The company added that the factory would reopen in a few days.
abstract: GlaxoSmithKline says drugs manufactured at its plant in Zebulon, NC, are safe, despite closure of factory following discovery of bacteria that causes Legionnaires' disease; plans to reopen plant in several days.
lead_paragraph: GlaxoSmithKline said the cooling towers where Legionella bacteria was found do not release air or water into the plant. The company added that the factory would reopen in a few days.

headline.main: Plant Closed for Bacteria; Glaxo Calls Its Drugs Safe
headline.print_headline: Glaxo Calls Its Drugs Safe Though Plant Had Bacteria
